body_html:
@peterjc123

Switched to the VS 2017 Python development environment. A change I was planning to do regardless.

Now using the Python 3.6 (64 bit) environment.

Installed torch: WHL
Environment: APPVEYOR_BUILD_WORKER_IMAGE=Visual Studio 2017, PYTHON_VERSION=3.6, TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=Pascal as before

It is listed in Packages and Intellisense.

Wrote the trivial test program

import numpy as np
import torch

if __name__ == "__main__":

	x = torch.rand(5,3)

However,
torch is reported as "torch: built in module torch" while
torch.rand is reported as "torch: when the mouse arrow hovers over each item.
Likewise for torch.as_numpy as per the introductory tutorial. Neither are listed in the drop down menu.
torch.Tensor is detected.
What am I missing?

Likewise for torch.as_numpy as per the introductory tutorial. Neither are listed in the drop down menu.

body:
@peterjc123

Switched to the VS 2017 Python development environment. A change I was planning to do regardless.

Now using the Python 3.6 (64 bit) environment.

Installed torch: WHL
Environment: APPVEYOR_BUILD_WORKER_IMAGE=Visual Studio 2017, PYTHON_VERSION=3.6, TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST=Pascal as before

It is listed in Packages and Intellisense.

Wrote the trivial test program

```
import numpy as np
import torch

if __name__ == "__main__":

	x = torch.rand(5,3)
```

However, 
torch is reported as "torch: built in module torch" while 
torch.rand is reported as "torch: <unknown type> when the mouse arrow hovers over each item.
Likewise for torch.as_numpy as per the introductory tutorial. Neither are listed in the drop down menu.
torch.Tensor is detected.
What am I missing?
